item.title: Defective Street Light, 17th September
item.description:
Outside Bexley Scout District, 85 Mayplace Road West, Bexleyheath, DA7 4JL: A street light is not working at night. I reported this on here two months ago however nothing has been done to fix it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Mayplace Road West, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped wheel clamp!, 17th September
item.description:
This has already been reported!!! There is a wheel clamp that someone has cut off of there vehicle and then dumped by the lamppost outside 59 Weir Hall Road, N18 1EL. It has been there absolutely ages....at a guess I would say the beginning of the year but it could very possibly be longer. Is Enfield Council going to come and get rid of it or should I do your jobs for you by going to get it and put it in my black bin?? Please advise??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London

item.title: Lots of leaves and other debris, 17th September
item.description:
Entrance to Alexander mews, litter and cigarette ends. In the mews, litter, leaves and debris making the street surface slippery. There is also a large amount of dog or fox poo mixed in. Please can the mews be swept and cleaned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Alexander Mews, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbery surface and giant gaps in the road, 17th September
item.description:
Hello on the 20th of july i was riding my motorcycle down this road in mild rain and this stuff that is used to fill the gaps in the road and the actual gaps in the road caused me to come off my motorcycle quite badly i have ended up with 3 fractured ribs a chipped shoulder a and both the rotator cuffs in my shoulders damaged to the point i have been un able to work since i have an eye witness from the area that can testify that i was not speeding or being dangerous if anything i was well under the limit and loads of residence that say the second that surface gets icy sometimes they cant even drive there cars up it so far from this neglagence i have lost out on money from forced sick leave aswell as the repairs to my motorcycle these gaps and surface on the road are not safe im only just starting to recover properly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glebelands, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why are these incredibly loud roadworks taking place at midnight on a weeknight?, 17th September
item.description:
It’s absolutely ridiculous that such loud road works are taking place at this time, nearby residents are now having to endure loud construction noise in addition to the constant traffic, sirens, trains and pub patrons.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elephant and Castle, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside burghley court (16-18 ingestre rd), 16th September
item.description:
The tree has grown back again over the last few years and is now touching most of the northern aspect of the top floor of the building and the north east corner of the building. I think it’s a Norwegian Maple tree- a total delight but I think better for the property if it’s trimmed back a bit as before. Many thanks for all your hard work. Much appreciated!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9, Ingestre Road, Tufnell Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People sitting with barking dogs every night, 16th September
item.description:
A couple sit in this playground with a pair dogs that bark constantly all night. It’s obviously a disruptive noise and always happens at night for 2/3 hours a night
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open manhole, 16th September
item.description:
This manhole cover is in Danson park by Danson house. It was not fixed down, I walked across it and slipped and went straight down it hurting my leg. The owner of chestnuts cafe in Danson house came out to help me and gave me ice and tried to cover the hole. I had little children with, this would have been extremely dangerous if one of them had fallen down the hole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
